item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: "A Lumix vai à Cidade"
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Bem, relato aqui a primeira vez que levei a minha Lumix FZ-20 para um passeio pelo Porto. Estava um dia feio, cinzento, por isso não dava bem para ver quão bonita a cidade consegue ser com a luz certa. No entanto, deu para começar a brincar um bocado. Este tipo não parava de olhar para mim…acho que estava a colar na minha máquina.   “Inner City Pressure”. Correria para cumprir horários, fugir ao movimento…só nos damos conta disto quanto não somos nós no meio da confusão. Sabe bem parar para variar.   Ainda deu para apanhar a Ana sem ser a fazer caretas. Gosto bastante do Preto e Branco com o fundo da baixa do porto..No entanto, o P&B digital não se compara a nenhum filme ilford…nesta altura ainda não editava nenhuma foto, o que acentua ainda mais isso. A segunda ida à cidade da Lumix foi em Braga, e começou no Arco da Porta Nova. Aqui, não só a construção antiga acompanha o P&B como o próprio casal o faz. Foi bonito ver o casal todo amoroso entre si, de braço dado como quem “dá força” para a rua a subir que se aproxima. Louco a lutar e a insultar inimigos invisíveis. A menina da foto dizia "...é que ele não se cala..!". É nestas alturas que o zoom de 12x dá jeito. A cidade de Braga até tem partes bonitas quando se pára para ver. O Pai Moderno. Da próxima vez peço autorização para tirar a foto (foi a primeira vez que pensei nesse assunto). Mas parece mesmo que está a posar o homem. o Senhor! A Marioneta Cansada. Assim como eu. O photowalk parou por aqui.

item.title: Uma manhã em Serralves (props prá Joana da Absolutributo)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Props porquê? Porque foi a Joana "Absoluta" que nos aconselhou a aproveitar a entrada gratuita ao domingo de manhã em Serralves! E que bem aconselhado! Já agora, a Joana é a simpática gerente da Loja de roupa e acessórios em segunda mão Absolutributo, na rua Formosa-Porto. Assim que actualizar tudo que é posts, vou fazer uma mini-sessão de fotos da loja em si! Fiquei tão contente com tudo o que o Jardim de Serralves tinha para oferecer, que nem fui visitar a Casa, confesso. Foi uma alegria pacífica, talvez pela harmonia entre a natureza e os caminhos pedonais, os espaços abertos e os mais recatados. Fotos a flores. Nunca tinha feito. (até que a Lumix conseguiu um "bokeh" bonito aqui)   Serralves Saturado e etc. O regresso deu para fotografar a imponente Câmara do Porto de uma posição que ainda não tinha experimentado.

item.title: Frango Assado com Batatas
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: e outras coisas ainda.

item.title: Até o arco-íris vem a preto e branco
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Esta foi a primeira vez em que tomei a sábia decisão de "se saio à noite com a câmara, só tiro fotos a preto e branco". Isto porque numa noite animada, tirar fotos sem flash revela-se pouco exequível. E tirar fotos com flash & a cores faz-me chorar por dentro. Então decidi, se uso flash, vai ser tudo a P&B! Luzes malucas e reflexos inesperados. Às vezes até são surpresas agradáveis! Candid shots no meio da pista xD E o regresso.

item.title: Vida analógica
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Se não contar com o contacto breve que tive com máquinas kodak descartáveis em passeios de escola, posso dizer que nunca tinha mexido suficiente em nenhuma máquin analógica. Até à data deste post. Então, aqui seguem as fotos tiradas com uma máquina de marca branca oferecida pelo meu avô, só sei que é preta e diz "Achiever" na frente, e uma yashica ME1. Vê-se o quão era inexperiente nisto porque: a)  fotos desfocadas; b) quis ser poupado e não pedir para digitalizar no laboratório, digitalizei eu em casa, com a câmara errada e com os skills de photoshop errados também. Vamos então ao pseudo-set. Tiradas com a Achiever e um rolo Polaroid ISO 100. Tiradas com a Yashica ME-1 e rolo Kodak color plus ISO 100.

item.title: Info
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This is the Shutter Hell Up blog. It's a photo journal, featuring raw street photography (mostly B&W and home developed),  music and some geek stuff. You can check my main site antoniocapelo which showcases most of my previous work. Hope you like it. António Capelo

item.title: Archives
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [Archives]

item.title: Código Vermelho
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Primeira vez que saí com a minha Praktica MTL5 mais a Helios 44-2. Rolo Fuji Superia 400 - para quem liga a isso - ﻿﻿﻿a ver como se comportava em fotos num interior com fraca luz. Pode ser que seja verdade e esteja a conseguir habituar-me às baixas velocidades de obturação. Got to slow it dow baby... Foi também a primeira vez que usei um flash numa máquina analógica, acho que se nota. Tenho exemplos onde o flash correu bem, só estou à espera de uma autorização por escrito das pessoas envolvidas. (Acho que a surbia não se importa de figurar) Ace (acima), dos MDG e o Maze dos DLM estiveram no Bar Code a passar Hip-Hop do bom (+Soul+Funk+RnB).

item.title: ZzzZenit
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Um rolo ISO 100 com a Zenit E+Helios 44-2. Digitalizado com a Lumix FZ-20   Em casa, depois na rua.

item.title: T-Bag.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: One legged person OR slow shutter speed... Rock On. Of course  it's a great idea! "You must believe me, he's the fastest man in the world!" E no fim de contas nem ficaram escandalizados com o que é um tea bag. A desilusão. No dia a seguir, 4 horas de sono e rumo à Feira da Vandoma, sem Lumix, mas com a câmara do iPhone.

item.title: Estou cá com uma Fomapan
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Bem, revelei o meu primeiro rolo,  um Fompan ISO 400. Depois de andar à luta com os monstros da escuridão e com a temperatura, o que saiu foi o que abaixo segue: Bar Code, once again. Kick, push.. "a kiss on tiptoes" Same street, different weather "Dark side of the face" Sorri, estás a beber uma caipirinha xD Alfarrabista (com rabistas e livros, também). "we're being followed" Ribeira brutal "the road to Marrakesh" Blinded by the lights, dizzy new heights   More rolls to come!

item.title: Photowalking
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: To clear my mind and enjoy the return of a nicer weather, I did a photowalk. In order to save the few rolls I have left, I brought the Lumix FZ-20 with me. Sooo, today's post is a digital one. "Enjoi": Waiting on sunshine. "it's funny because they took half of your blood!" always on the lookout. taking care of business. give me a green light.. "enjoi" skating on the top of her world.

item.title: What the fed?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Now here we have some random shots taken with the FED-3B! No light meter on this rangefinder camera so I had to trust my instinct, bear it! The Industar 61 lens that comes with this camera is pretty sharp, besides beeing pretty ;)



This old sea-wolf was selling fishing nets on the flea market


whoa, dont' remember what caused this big flare, but I guess that someone put the Sun above the table.



Sushi+sushi+sushi+sushi+all you can eat!


"look at you, you skinny fellow"

More rolls soon

item.title: Don't run away
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Some more rolls, home developed, and scanned with my new scanner. The camera: fed3b, again. I used a fed5b the other day...didn't like it as much, it's bigger and it still doesn't have a light meter. Fed3b it is!

Waiting on sunshine.



Candid shot, baby!


No time to loose, got work to do.




@ Absolutributo vintage fripes shop - Porto


Street Performer's break time.





Faces at Vandoma - Flea Market



Runaway Bride!


More rolls coming soon.
A. Capelo

First shots with my favorite analog baby camera, the Canonet QL17, which was a birthday gift from my girlfriend. Got to give her PROPS for that! xD

item.title: Life in Analog - Street Photography Exposition! Part I
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: My first photography exposition is ready and waiting for your feedback! It's a collection of some shots of my first approach to street photography, most of them taken place in the city of Porto. So, if you're on the neighborhood of Porto and you wanna see some raw street photography (and, who knows, buy a piece of original clothing), come by the Absolutribut store from 12-09 to 24-09!

item.title: Rituals
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Okay, since I was kind of busy arranging my first photography exposition, I let some rolls undeveloped. So, without further ado, here you have some shots from the concert nights at Noites Ritual and, as usual, random shots. All these were taken with the Canonet QL17 and Kentmere 100 / 400 ISO films.

item.title: Summer + Unawareness
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Well, I have to upload these Summer photos before the Autumn comes! This August I spent some time in Alentejo, in the south of Portugal. As there's not so many "streets" there, I couldn't do exactly street photography, let's just call it photography this time, ok? =P

Bay Watching


Rose ;)


back window


time to clear the house entrance!


leaves+mariana


White sand


Enjoying some snails!


Beyond the Tejo


Whose Line Is it Anyway?


MJ


ZC


John Doe with the sun on his back.

Now, these next shots are what happens when you're unaware that the camera you're testing has a film on it...a colour film, by the way..


unaware I


unaware II - Grandma


unaware III - outafocus


unaware IV - Teaser Recording


unaware V - Flash's Bike

Next post will feature some Olympus E-P1 shots, be sure to come check it!

A. Capelo

item.title: Oh joy!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Some shots from my Olympus Pen E-P1 ."Digital goodness in a rangefinder format " :) The camera can reproduce some great colors so, for some pictures it would be a seen to put them on Black and White! For all the B&W fans, bear with those :P Kid's Trone Black Thoughts Lions Waiting Alone time Red&Blue The girl in the other room HNTS Stone Cold 50% off Urban Indians Portrait in camera talk Goin' Underground Too Loud Damn Mirror Contracted FMI - 4ever Luv More rolls to come! (digital or analog ;))

item.title: stairs and pillows
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In this post, I'm back to the analog ways: these are some shots from my brand new Yashica Minister-D and the "sharp shooter" Canonet QL17, loaded up with some kentmere400 rolls. Cold stair Give the Drummer Somme! The two men mosh-pit: Part I The two men mosh-pit: Part II distraction / seduction Alone in the dark. Noir scene I refuse to use the flash! Lunch Break - leave coins here. 3 glasses, 2 faces Missfocused, late night... Gettin their groove on before after They can do it! Frisbee at the park Musical Ollie. Hope you like it, more rolls to come! A. Capelo

item.title: Half-frame, (almost) twice the fun
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Here you go, shots from my "new" half-frame camera, an Olympus Pen EE-3. It's nice to have twice the number of expositions in one film, and the result quality is still very good! From this post on, I'll finish with a photo of the camera(s) that was used, for the camera-friends out there! In this post, I'll also put some color photos, as I kinda like the result tones from this Zuiko lens. Herbs Great optics, Lima! Putcha Lighters up Walking the bears. Get ready for some colors: Chili Peppers Colored Seller Skipping and jumping Hats Same outfit The red sneaker. Now, back to Black and White: Upwards 4 Faces Taking care of business II Dark balloon man Fashion Talk Birds Angle As promised, this was the camera used with this roll: More rolls to come!A. Capelo

item.title: Roadtrippin'
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hey, I "just" came from a roadtrip with my friends, we spent 5 days visiting Toledo, Madrid and Salamanca. You can figure that I did *some* photos of those days, so here they are (well, except for the ones that I didn't developed yet):


5pain


Keep your space old pal'


montaditos+cañas+tostadas+yonosequemas

(noticed the guy with that strange salute?)


best "catarata" in Spain


Gaining some air


Everyday of a skater


Stretching before some cathedral visiting


rollin' down Madrid


She was pretty high that time..


I ain't afraid of no height


Street Artist in Toledo


King Zack the 1st


Bench Surfin'


His window


Enjoying some hardcore art - part I


Enjoying some hardcore art - part II


Leica Magic (or "Me encanta tu Leica!")


Self-Portrait in Toledo


"Where my dogs at?"


Negocios, tio!


and we have a liftoff


yup


X-treme-hardcore sports in Spain


Oh yeah, I manage to see Queen in Spain, too


The Dog and the man

Since I forgot the battery charger for my Olympus E-P1 (doh!), I had to improvise with my Canon Prima 5 (to be developed) and my iPhone 3G, so enjoy these next 2 Megapixel goodness =P


5+1


Warp Speed


Chihuahua


Sleeping in the museum


A 2 da N A


Band Photo =/

Hope you liked it!

**

A. Capelo

item.title: Roadtrippin' (analog & uncut version)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hey, since the poll I initiated on Facebook was approved by "all", here it is, the uncut version of the 35mm film I took with me on the roadtrip to Spain.

Just for the record, by "uncut" I'm not saying that these are hardcore, blowyamind, extremely not-suitable-for work kind of photos.

By "uncut" I mean I did not select the good pictures, or the cute smiles, and I definitely did not deleted photos that can be used, in the future, to blackmail any of the characters bellow...

Night in Toledo


cheap cider


dead-end for feet


doing the dishes to pay for the hostel

Blinded by the lights xD

gentlemen

tough nights

bench, stairs or barrel

barmaid in Toledo



Blinded by the lighs part II xD


Chillin'


Can't imagine who he is..

"they're fishes"

waking up in Madrid.

Managed to take some nice photos there too:


Back to you, tapas


This composition was...totally planned.

Flashing the mirror.

And that's it.

More rolls / jpeg's to come!

A. Capelo

item.title: street+pseudofashion+praxis
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Haven't posted much because my MacBook is at the repair centre, so it took me about 3 days to make this post ... =P random.photos.GO! And there I was, taking some photos of a friends at the University Fashion model contest, when someone asked me to take photos of the models....After that night I discovered that I hate taking this kind of photos...also I'm not very good at it.. models come models go   I prefer taking pictures of other things...

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hey! So I had some unpublished photos in my SD Card and decided to upload them, just so I can format it with clean conscience. Also, I thought that it would be cool to show some photos I took with my former mobile phone, the iPhone 3G. I put it aside because it was becoming really slow but I miss its camera as it was silent, focus free and relatively sharp!

These are the "real" camera photos:

Street shopping

girl in the wall

They will remember it

See you soon!

More rolls to come,

A. Capelo

This guy! looking "you funny mickey…" busted back2back smoke mouse break unknown bus rider crysis Next post: Some photos from my analog SLR, the Minolta Dynax 303si, and more! António Capelo

item.title: it's super(ia) man
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
As I said on the previous post, the next photos are from my "new" analog SLR camera, the Minolta Dynax 303si. It's a pretty straight-forward camera, you don't have any control over the aperture or velocity, so you choose between some pre-set modes. In my opinion, it's a nice camera to any beginner or even if you don't want to tweak any parameters (in street photography, it happens sometimes). Film used: Superia 200. City: Braga.

I didn't like half the photos of the roll, so, here you go, the photos that I can live with :P


Dragon Ball!!! Had to take the photo


the bikes the cameras the box in the head..wait, what?


Amazed


two 3's


I was tying my shoelace xD


Train station scene


Ahoy!

Camera used:


More rolls to come!

A. Capelo

item.title: Picnic with 400ASA

In order to celebrate Helena's birthday we did a picnic on a sunny afternoon and, to celebrate the fact that my Helios 44-2 lens arrived, I took it with me, together with a Praktica MTL5B. So, for today's menu we have a picnic, some guessing games and street photos. Enjoy your meal!

Speech

emergency exits -> sides




upandaway


*slip*

















More rolls to come,

António Capelo

item.title: in soviet Russia, Leica shoots you.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I was missing shooting with my Fed3b, my first rangefinder, so last week I picked it up and went to the streets. The Fed3B is a soviet-era Leica copy, which resembles a Leica M3. Advantages (besides being damn pretty): silent shutter, nice handling and weight, good glass available (I used an Industar I-61). On the other hand, its viewfinder is anything but bright, so in order to focus quickly, you have to practice a bit, and it does not have a light meter. This last "feature" caused some under/overexposed shots, when my sunny 16 rule was not so accurate. Still, I got some nice shots with a Kodak Tri-X 400:

Wait! Before that, let me remind you, my new website is up and running, you can check it at www.antoniocapelo.com!


Alley Cat


italian


Tiago look at the dinosaurs

item.title: Buffet!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi there! Two sets: Random photo walk with my Canonet and some Lisbon shots (bear with the color!) with the Yashica : cpf background camouflage Bolhao talk hard study two stories gondomar ;) Sta. Apolónia "I'm feeling better, thanks" wink strange guy catching doves busted! (Porto) crashing place. More rolls (and CF cards…) to come! A. Capelo

item.title: Street Shots / Concert snapshots
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Here ya go, some colored street shots with the Olympus PEN E-P1 which, btw, is now for sale. I love the pen, but bigger plans force me to sell it. If you want a beautiful camera + lens + strap + batteries + cf cards + vintage adapters + original flash, contact me! After this color shots, you'll find some snapshots I took with my iPhone last night on the Dilated Peoples' show! Just found an app that simulates the film look pretty well! Facing life street's fireplace Yours truly Scarf Lady ink LM Just him, music, and his coke

item.title: D!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Well, this post shows my first shots with my *new" camera, the 350D. Although it's not as comfortable (and discrete) for street photography as a rangefinder, I find it a very "solid" camera, with nice controls and very decent results! Besides that, it's always nice to have a digital camera when I'm out of film. saturday morning working like a dog chasin' thoughts the last bit of sunlight :) Braga - European Youth Capital.. Carnival, everyone! Carnival, not for everyone. IM "no, thanks" Ana flowerstore problem? golden "has it come to this?" Next post, more (real) rolls to come! A.Capelo

item.title: Me Myself & I
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The last couple of weeks were pretty busy, so I didn't have enough time to develop my last rolls of film. Nevertheless, I uploaded the last roll I shot with my Yashica ME-1! It's a zone-focusing camera, which is nice for street photography, with a decently sharp f2.8 yashinon lens. Besides that, it's really nice to hold and handle, and it has a very sleek look. Mrs. Shadow assembling Ribeira State of Mind Old News Bouncer Bolhão, can't get enough Happiness seen from above More (real) rolls to come!A. Capelo

item.title: Olympus OMG-10
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: First rolls with my "new" olympus om-10, I bought it on the bay, it came with a clean look but not so clean lens…I guess it didn't make a big difference on the final results but I have to test it some more. Bellow you have shots with a Kodak T-Max 400 pushed to 800, a crappy color roll expired since 1998 (lol) and Ilford HP5 400 pushed to 800 (check we-love-film.com/ for some analog stuff and nice service). Kodak T-Max: no cider yes cider Asturian playing asturian dancing jb same room, different temperatures flash shot - roll your eyes! alone or lonely? Chillin' at the park Crappy color film from the 90's: Ilford HP5 400: 3€ each me (shot by Ana).. I think that the only photo she took was probably the best of the entire roll..! self-portrait "damn, I missed it!" weird a** movie clip, continuously on loop talk in the dark Ana (shot by me…also shot by Luis) Look, laundry me gust coffee cup xD More rolls to come! A. Capelo

item.title: ah…push it!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Yo! New photos from two rolls, fuji superia 200 and Ilford HP5 400 pushed to 800 (from we-love-film.com/), both shot with Olympus OM-10. I'm really liking this SLR, it's sturdy and quick to handle, I almost forget those fungus on its lens..So, hereyago, picnic photos, street photos, photos of my photos on a photography exhibition, and some from Capicua's concert last saturday.


Nice picnic at Jardins de Serralves

we're smart people so we go to photography exhibitions :D

item.title: Beats, yo!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hey!
Not a photo post (I believe it's the first one), this one is just to post my new beatmaking video. It's a beat I made 2 weeks ago, and I decided to show the main samples & ideas in one quick jam. So, nothing prepared or sequenced, just me banging my head and hitting some pads!
 
[youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=834BebfSX04]
 
Hope you like it!
A. Capelo (aka Stereo Tipo)

item.title: 35mm and stuff
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: These were taken with a Olympus OM-10+ Zuiko 1.8 + ilford HP5 400 roll (from we-love-film) pushed to 1600. It was my first *push" to 1600, and the ID-11 developer was already a bit worn out, but I think it went OK. I'm still to figure out if some lighter parts of some negs were from the developing process or the age of the film… Check it: youth is coming comfort My camera was taken from my hands with extreme violence, so that this next 3 shots could be taken: Feel Good Pete Dark John R. Kiosk Henri Cartier-Bresson? :) Focus is overrated! :p v fight subway "looks like it's windy" Posers Short-film? focus is overrated pt.2 cocktail talk taste it cocktail silence More rolls to come! A. Capelo

item.dc:creator: admin

Hey 'everybody', this time I bring you a ilford HP5 400 (from we-love-film.com) shot with my Yashica ME-1, between Porto and Braga. In one or two shots I felt the light meter didn't work as it should, but nothing too off. Also, I decided that I need a reliable flash unit..the ones I got were bought in flea markets for a nice price but their lamps are very worn out and they don't fire every time I press the shutter xD.

item.dc:creator: admin

Hey there,

Last weekend I used two expired (more than 10 years) and crappy color films on my Olympus OM-10, and unexpectedly most of my shots got ruined!

So before the OM-10 ones, I'll put some taken with a Olympus PEN EE-3:

Now the Olympus OM-10 shots:

item.title: Grain!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Today I bring you an half-digital, half-analog post (it's more 1/4 digital, 3/4 analog). The digital ones are from my Canon 350D, when I went out without rolls with me. The others were taken with my Fed 3b with the Industar I-61 lens and a Ilford HP5 400 film. I'm not sure what went wrong, but this roll came out very grainy, even with the ID-11 and the usual developing scheme that I use. Ok, first the DSLR's... eyes could not resist compliment stone cold Hello Kodak Now, ready for some grain? Nês 'sup? Party Po(o)pers tragedy! shoemakah behind the ruins lots of vertical shots… =/ give me a green light aged stairs More rolls to come, A. Capelo

item.title: iso100 and no sun
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi there, I've been busy these last weeks but I can handle the college projects and study marathons pretty well..what gets on my nerves its the damn rain and cold weather we're having!   Hey Rain: Eat a bag of dicks. Well, on the lack of B&W films I decided to use those Agfa Vista 100 that I bought some weeks ago. So a lot of color shots on this post. Then I decided that I'm not a big fan of color (especially at iso 100) so the second rollI was shot as it were a 400 iso, and I converted most of the pics to B&W. Yeah, I'm mad like that. Then I decided that I can't do those 2 things at the same time, or I'll get this kind of grainy and "dirty" negatives. I'm thinking of using these color rolls more and try to develop them with B&W chemicals, so I can save some euros on the lab developing. The first ones were shot with a Yashica ME-1 and the second one with my trusty canonet ql17. Have a look: homecooked ride back home out of focus because my arms aren't long enough TL yey balloons resistance toprockin' photo of a photo being taken where I go almost everyday :/ January 31st yes the usual elevator shot And now the iso100as400colortob&wphoto experiment begins homeangled before the budda power blues concert and those are the Budda Power Blues   iso100+f1.7 <3 I liked this one in color, so I leaved it that way   some serious issues S! "but the point is" two sides   wizzard New rolls to come (even more if the sun decides to shine) A. Capelo

item.title: Pnizzz
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Finally got my hands on a Zorki 4k rangefinder, with its appropriate Jupiter-8 lens, and went to test it with a roll of Ilford HP5 400 (pushed to 1600) from we-love-film.com.


The camera is a beauty , really solid and it has a bright viewfinder. So bright that on the first shots it was kind of hard to focus, but by the end of the roll I was focusing pretty quickly. I used hp5+2 because I wanted to try how this f2 lens would behave on low light and I think it went well. The problem with analog photography is when you shoot a roll of ISO 1600 at night, don't finish it and then try to finish on the new (very sunny) day..

Oh, no light meter, you have to guessmeter all the time and it turns out the next-day shots could be better exposed :P




I predict a catfight


"delicious"


Coronel

(should've used 1/15 at least, instead of 1/30)


Arcadas


St. Penizzz



Testing the focus to infinity


old reflection ii


morning cleanup



Now, a previous roll from my QL17


drums - budda power blues (end of roll)


bdp (end of roll)


Oh, about two weeks ago we went to the "de Clone a Clown" (from clone to clown) book release by our friend Vitor Briga





room in regular day of exams period


café



shadowshoeshining





I risked my life to take this shot


old photolabs <<3


postcard-like


New rolls to come,

A. Capelo

item.title: apx100 & photoart
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I ran out of B&W rolls and fixer so I wen to the fellas at Câmaras & Companhia and bought some Foma Fixer and a roll of APX100. The film is indeed contrasty, as I read online, but I didn't felt an excessive amount of grain. In fact, I enjoyed this film very much (I've bought 2 more rolls already).

I also received a package with the the Olympus XA2 that I won in an auction for a very low price. Turns out that the low price was due to the camera being broken. Maybe because the shutter seems to be bit by a furious dog. I managed to fix it (for how long? that I don't know), and in the process of realizing that the camera had a problem, I created real photographic art, a mixture of realities, a two-sided capture. That, or I double-exposed the entire roll.

Let's open with the crap, I mean, art (so good I don't even put it on my flickr. and I put everything on my flickr…)








And now, the zorki 4k + Jupiter8 + apx100:



Life is



ikea furniture assembly party


if (empty(glass)==1) then focus



F!




õ.Õ



Northern Tourists enjoy the sun in Portugal






</60000>nap in t900park

Helena's View


it's a trap!


active


praise the sun





dealin'


IT


gardening at the balcony

More rolls to come,

A. Capelo

item.title: Darkness falls
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hey there

Last week, amongst other things unrelated to this blog, I tested my new analog SLR, the exa 1b. I got mine from Máquinas de Outros Tempos. As you can see in the next picture, the camera is quite different. It doesn't have a light meter and the range of speeds is short (1/30 slowest and 1/175 fastest), so it has a somewhat limited use. However, its size is really good, the shutter release is very original and the waist level finder is quite nice. It forces you to slow down to shoot and gives you a new angle and perspective.

The first shots are from a APX100 film and were taken with this exa 1b. The second batch is from a kodak tri-x 400 roll pushed to 1600 and burned with the zorki 4k.


prints for the upcoming exhibition


degraded shopping


the finger


till' the end of roll


Creepy store


Ana

Now the tri-x ones. lots of available light as you can see:


whispers


K

(epic photo)


"really?"


J Bangs


Pierre


V.Fight + D900ness


Moustache Monkey

don't know who took this photo


Batalha





S in focus


tea and coffee


late work

More rolls to come!

A. Capelo

item.title: Rock & stuff
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Quick post before I leave home to see Erykah Badu live @ Cascais Music Fest and to enjoy a week of beach&relaxation. Last sunday I watched a concert from a friend's band at the center of Braga, and took some shots of their performance. I used a olympus xa2 (roll to be developed) and my canon 350D with the regular kit lens, a cheap m42-lens, and a friend's 'big lens' that i'm not used to! So bear with the next 13 digital shots. The band's name is Pulse and you can check them on myspace. do it ;) On the analog side, I uploaded some shots taken with my Olympus OM-10 + Zuiko 50mm f1.8 and a roll of Agfa Vista 100. Not the regular resolution because I didn't have my scanner with me, so the Lab's scan had to do it. Enjoy! So, first the CF Card (which is more and more difficult do find these days): And now, the agfa vista roll: don't know what's got into me…shooting nature and stuff.. O.o and a sentimental / sensible moment of me also went to the beach Gaia reminisce Some clouds would have been welcome for this shot.. river people deaddove no tricks mapping And now I'll get some sleep, tomorrow will be On & On! See ya in a week or so! A. Capelo

item.title: 20ftTall
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: So I got to develop the rolls from the the last weeks and I have some photos to show you. Let me just say that the Erykah Badu's show was dope! I had the highest expectations and she (and her musicians) didn't let me down! (not my photo, mines were too far, but I had to post one photo of the event) Moving on to the normal life, we have some leftovers from a rock concert in Braga, Beach shots, feels-just-like-it-should shots, wc portrait, and other randomness. Gear used: Olympus XA2 and Canonet QL17, with Ilford HP5 400 pushed to 800 and Agfa Vista 100. In a few days i'll put some street photography (I know you miss it) ones, taken while testing the Protopan 400 film. MJ Partying Alentejo cityskape hear the sun Festival de Musicas do Mundo @ Sines Self-Portrait @ Festival de Musicas do Mundo - WC Chicken run. As you can see, I had a fundamental role blood was shed. by the mulberry tree M&C goin' North Let the morning come leap into More rolls to come, A. Capelo

item.title: "I don't like sand. Sand gets everywhere"
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Want a little bit of summer pictures + street shots? Let's go then! AH! Not so fast. IF you're in the surroundings of Porto, be sure to see my very humble photography exhibition entitled "When the glass is broken". It's on from 13th August to the middle of September on Absolutribut. So you get to see a little bit of street photography and some nice second hand & vintage clothing! On to the next subject: First roll - Agfa Vista 100 (expired in 2011) was shot with the Olympus XA2, one of the cutest cameras I own. I really need to buy nice color rolls, this ones were cheap enough to test the new cameras and as a last resource when I'm out of film, but they don't do justice to the gear their in. It's not that I don't like the colors, they're as expected for a *cheap* and expired film, some of the photos got a special look because of it (real life instagram, boy!), but they're not very even.. Plus, the developed film has too many "white dots" on it and I'm yet to find if it's the film's fault, or the low-cost photo lab's fault… That makes me want to start developing color film =/ Next agfa will be developed in another lab, just to make things clear (and dot-free). sargaço. I really love that purple line.. sargaço + couple burned landscape found items I'd never thought before yeah son, francesinha @ O Mestre. the illest of them all xD so 70's again, that purple line..wow. surf the sidewalk More interesting stuff:by looking to some of my last pictures taken with the Canonet QL-17, which 80% came inclined, I thought one of two things: 1) I'm drunk everytime I use that camera, or 2) the framing lines are misplaced. So then I did a quick visit to Mr. Adriano - the machine wizard - workshop, to get my rangefinder fixed. For these shots, the light was low, so I had to use a tripod. His tripod ;D Some weeks ago, the We Love Film project received a new film, the Protopan400, and I ordered some rolls to test it. There's little information on it online, few or none reviews, but at least they got us a development table =P I used it with it's original ISO, 400, developed it in Rodinal for 10 minutes n 20ºC (or so). I found it a nice film, I wish it were a little bit more contrasty, as some of the frames came out a bit 'flat', but next time I think i'll push it to get more contrast. Protopan 400 + Canonet QL-17: look for your own heart repairs sunset @ Vila do Conde cuteness missfocused known faces world inside a van nice landing city jogging advice really like this one xD More rolls to come, A. Capelo

item.title: worstpost
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Oh, the light…the light is great because, amongst other things, makes photography possible.

But when you're developing a roll, when pouring out the pre-wash water, if you haven't locked the tank right, it opens and f*cks up your film.

  • Noob mistake when you've already developed some dozens of rolls: check!

After screwing up a roll of HP5, I decided to shot another roll while testing a Yashica Minister D rangefinder. Turns out that this camera's light seals were too much worn out so I just screwed another roll of HP5.

  • Screw two rolls in a row: check!

At least the Agfa roll taken with the Canon Prima 5 came out "nice" (and I concluded that the white dots I complained about were the Lab's fault).

Ready for the worst post on this blog? I hope so, because I'm such an honest guy that I post almost every photo I get...

Braga - one of We Are Young parties

lines

this would be a nice shot

from Denmark

and a "oh that looks like from 20 years ago" one

umbrellas in August :/

S

102

Rainy days in August

record

Layers

More rolls to come! (Hopefully, well developed)

A. Capelo

Lots of things happened since our last roll…

For example, I took more photos…with a Praktica MTL5 + Helios 44-2 + Ilford HP5 400 (Set 1) and with a Canonet QL-17 + Protopan 400 (set2).

item.title: I wanna Gdansk with somebody
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: yawn.. I should've been asleep by now, but this post was long overdue. These are (most of) the Black&White shots from my trip to Poland. Did you see the post title? got it? Great, right? This amazing wordplay was made by Pedro and because of that, this post features 2 pics of him. you're welcome. The camera used was the trusty Canonet QL 17, with rolls Rollei RPX400, APX400 and HP5. Here ya go. Gdansk Parenting Thrones Pedro and the joy of analog photography Bad Lion Gdansk got tunnels nice CS map Z-Man daydreamin' Malbork inspiration the epic 12hours train ride…had plenty of time to take photos, but most of them are a bit embarrassing, so I just uploaded the 'pretty' ones.. arrived in Krakow waiting for the breakfast at the kick-ass Mundo Hostel (which I totally recommend btw). f*ck yeah, breakfast! naturals coffee couple rawscan late market alchemia talk entrance at the lobby 80º anotherglassesShot NIce pickup line, bro! *ironic fist bump* Poland got bridges the frog shot! thug +bycicles krakowAmbience

item.title: Best Case Scenario
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Well, the Algorithms exam is done and now I can post this set (or sets). I First, there are some left-overs from Poland (RPX400) and a 3 month old HP5 400, taken with my Canonet QL17. On these two, you'll have to bear with the crappy photo lab scan..no time, desperate measures. Lastly, a HP5 400 shot with my new rangefinder, the cute Revue 400se, bought on Máquinas de Outros Tempos, check out their facebook page! patpat No more Poland shots. This is the grainy roll from some months ago, the HP5400 pushed to 800 with ID-11..it's strange because it's supposed to be a a fine grain developer..I suppose it's because this portion was made too long ago.. that's ma dogs She the other side of the river @Guedes another train strike Now the Revue 400se shots, taken with a Ilford HP5 400, not pushed. This time, with a new bottle of ID-11. You can tell that this little rangefinder besides beautiful is very sharp. PHPing Ana energy++ revue rocks light it shoot Mo before he flies more train strikes bike0.8 xD More rolls to come! A. Capelo

No time to write, my battery is draining right now..! nice and calm view super-ultra-speed m/ proud owner (facing the sun) sunday afternoon bolhao hidden allie self -- Now the Revue 400SE set the sky on fire nap time for two goodbye by the bridge all of the lights vandoma praise the lord A. item.title: Kong
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hi!

It's been some time since my last post: I went out of web hosting, got lots of work to do and decided to wait until I remade my site (check it) to come back to blogging.

And I miss it!

Well, I have some leftover pics to show you, some taken with my revue 400SE, Praktica MTL5B and a crappy-expired-disposable camera.

So, the Revue ones:


fmi


without


with

Engineering Dinner - lots of emotions?


some happy with the flash

even me, so it seems

noir

----

Now the crappy disposable camera and the Praktica ones:



misfit




Java Training

on my private photobooth

I'll end this post with a not so frequent format: 120!

I had the opportunity to test a Kiev 88CM from Sitio do Cano Amarelo with a Kodak Portra roll and a friend of mine. The results were clear, I really like the definition and the bokeh. The color is great and I have to say that it's tricky to handle the waist-level-finder focusind. These are the ones that came out right:


(These next 3 photos by Daniel Coelho)

Aaaand thank god I didn't pursue a modeling career.

More rolls to come.

A. Capelo
